Header.idTip:
id - Task unique idenfication
Not used for automatically created grouped tasks
Used especially to assign dependencies to tasks and to identify tasks when saving changes to server
Header.TASKTip: Task name, the same for more rows, any custom string
Header.SECTIONTip:
Name of individual task part, any custom string
When grouped, it shows task name in parent and the section name in child row
Header.STARTTip: Start date (and time) of the task, first plan
Header.ENDTip: End date (and time) of the task, first plan
Header.COMPLETETip:
Percentage completion of the task, first plan
By default only not started tasks (0%) can be scheduled
Header.DURATIONTip: Duration in hours of the task, first plan
Header.TEXTTip: Task custom information, here shown in task tip, first plan
Header.DISABLEDTip: If the task is disabled or locked
Header.START1Tip: Start date (and time) of the task, second plan
Header.END1Tip: End date (and time) of the task, second plan
Header.DURATION1Tip: Duration in hours of the task, second plan
Header.PARTS1Tip: Start and End dates of individual parts, if the task is discrete, second plan
Header.TEXT1Tip: Task custom information, here shown in task tip, second plan
Header.DESCENDANTSTip: (Successors) Dependencies to next tasks, their ids, optionally with lag, span and color, here used for task first plan
Header.ANCESTORSTip: (Predecessors) Dependencies from previous tasks, their ids, optionally with lag, span and color, here used for task first plan
Header.SLACKTip:
Calculated value for task first plan, in hours
How much the task can be delayed to not affect the project end date (or start date)
If it is 0, the task is on critical path
If it is negative, the task is incorrect
Header.CALENDARTip:
Custom calendar for all task plans and other Gantt objects.
Defines excluded dates ingored in Gantt calculations
Header.RESOURCESTip:
Resources assigned to task, first plan
Used to calculate task price and to show project resources usage in the grid bottom
Header.PRICETip: Price of the task, first plan. Calculated from the resources assigned to task and the task duration
Header.PROGRESSTip: Results of internal calculations to show progress line for the task
Header.MINSTARTTip: Early start constraint, here used for the task first plan
Header.MAXSTARTTip: Late start constraint, here used for the task first plan
Header.MINENDTip: Early end constraint, here used for the task first plan
Header.MAXENDTip: Late end constraint, here used for the task first plan
Header.FLAGSTip: Icon on the selected date, for custom information for the date
Header.FLAGSTEXTTip: Custom information for the flag date

C.Name: GANTT
C.GanttLine0Tip: Actual date for this project is at *Start*

C.Name: GANTT
C.GanttTip:
*id*. *TASK*, *SECTION* (first bar)
*Start* - *End*
*Duration* hours, *COMPLETE* completed
*SLACK* hours reserve
*Text*

Z.Name: quarters and seconds
Z.GanttHeader1: s15#ddd dddddd MMMM yyyy, ''HH:mm' quarter minute'

Tabber.Info: All the demonstrated features can be fully customized via XML / JSON data or via JavaScript API

Group.ListTip: Grouping rows according to some column(s) values
Group.ZoomTip: Zoom level, available from milliseconds to years
Group.FitTip: Chooses zoom level to show all the Gantt objects in one window
Group.MaxTip:
Chooses zoom level to show all the Gantt objects in one window.
Maximizes the place for the Gantt chart by shrinking the columns section.
Group.ExTip: Global calendar for the whole project
Group.HidExTip: Hides dates excluded by the global calendar
Group.CalTip: Permits custom calendars for individual tasks
Group.BarTip: Demonstrates changing bar heights and vertical positions

Topbar2.BaseTip:
Starting date of the whole project.
If grayed, it is calculated from the first task.
No task should start before it.
It is also used when correcting dependencies.
Topbar2.FinishTip:
Finish date of the whole project.
If grayed, it is calculated from the last task.
It is used to calculate critical path.
Topbar2.ProgressTip:
Progress line connects incomplete tasks before the progress date
It is possible to have more such lines in chart, even with different meaning
Topbar2.CritTip: Show only critical tasks, all other rows will be hidden
Topbar2.DepTip: If the dependent tasks will automatically be scheduled after some task is moved or resized
Topbar2.CfgTip: Shows global dialog to change Gantt settings

Toolbar1.ResourcesTip: Shows only rows containing selected resources
Toolbar1.ChartTip: Select which resource charts in grid bottom will be shown
Toolbar1.ColsTip:
Select column groups to show
To show or hide particular columns use Columns menu on bottom toolbar
Toolbar1.SingleTip:
Show the toolbar row to choose individual objects and editing actions
Useful especially for controlling Gantt chart by single finger on touch screen
Toolbar1.WinTip: Disable grid scrollbars and use page scrollbars
Toolbar1.WinOnChange: Grid.NoVScroll = Value; Grid.NoHScroll = Value; if(!Value) { Grid.MainTag.style.width=''; Grid.MainTag.style.height='900px'; } Grid.SetMaxHeight(!Value); Grid.Update();

Header.idTip: Resource name. By this name is the resource assigned to the individual tasks

Header.STARTTip: Price for one resource unit in USD

Header.ENDTip: Amount of available resource units per dates

Header.DURATIONTip: Maximal used resource units at one time in the whole Gantt chart

Header.COMPLETETip: Type of the resource consuming, work or material

Header.DESCENDANTSTip: Amount of all resource units used by all tasks

Header.ANCESTORSTip: Price for all used resource units in the whole chart

Header.GANTTTip:
Resource usage chart
Click to zoom in, right click to zoom out
Control the displed charts in bottom combo "Show resource charts"
